prompt: Facts: Appellant (Ravinder @ Julie) married the deceased (Pooja) approximately two years prior to the incident.; Incident occurred on 15.07.2016 at House No. 174, Gali No. 5, Village Mandoli Extension, Delhi.; Information regarding Pooja hanging herself was received vide DD No. 34A at PS Harsh Vihar on 15.07.2016.; Police officials (SI Narender Kumar, Ct. Parveen Kumar) reached the spot and found Pooja hanging from a ceiling fan with a 'chunni'.; The body was brought down with the help of family members and sent to GTB Hospital.; Neeraj Kumar (PW1), brother of the deceased, gave a statement alleging dowry demands (car, cash) and harassment by the appellant soon after marriage.; PW1 alleged that due to non-fulfillment of demands, Pooja was harassed and beaten by the appellant.; PW1 stated that Pooja had informed him and his sister (PW2-Poonam) about the harassment over the phone.; Based on PW1's statement, FIR No. 494/2016 was registered under Sections 498A/304B IPC at PS Harsh Vihar.; Post-mortem examination (conducted by PW3-Dr. Munish Wadhawan) concluded the cause of death as 'asphyxia as a result of ante-mortem hanging'.; Investigation included site inspection, seizure of ligature material ('chunni'), recording witness statements, and arresting the appellant.; Trial Court (ASJ, Karkardooma Courts, Delhi) framed charges under Sections 498A/304B IPC against the appellant.; Trial Court convicted the appellant under Sections 498A and 304B IPC vide judgment dated 28.05.2019.; Appellant was sentenced to Rigorous Imprisonment (RI) for 10 years for the offence under Section 304B IPC and RI for 3 years with a fine of Rs. 10,000/- for the offence under Section 498A IPC (sentences to run concurrently).; Appellant filed an appeal (CRL.A. 678/2019) in the Delhi High Court challenging the conviction and sentence. | IPC: Section 498A, Section 304B
